intro: Melampyrum dacicum, commonly known as the Caucasian touch-me-not, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountains of the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. The species is noted for its ability to thrive in poor, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and alpine meadows.
